title: Power dissipated in copper rod on U-shaped rails

content.question: A copper rod of resistance R is in electrical contact with a frictionless U-shaped rail of width L and negligible resistance. The rod is pulled to the right at a constant velocity <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. A magnetic field <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mi>B</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is directed into the page, as shown in the figure above. Under these conditions, the electric power dissipated in the rod is P. If the velocity of the rod is doubled and the magnetic field strength is reduced by half, the power dissipated in the rod is

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
